choices.A: Define the remote span VLAN on SW1 and SW2.
choices.C: Encrypt the traffic between the users and the monitoring servers.
choices.D: Enable the Cisco Discovery Protocol on the server interfaces.
choices.B: Disable the spanning tree protocol on the monitoring server VLAN.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Set the following on both switches
SW(config)# vlan 50
SW(config-vlan)# remote-span

Selected Answer: A
monitor session 1 type rspan-source
→ must define a RSPAN VLAN

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must send the 172.16.2.0 /24 user traffic to a packet capture tool to troubleshoot an issue. Which action completes the configuration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
RESTful API Basic Authentication uses Base64 encoding to convert the username and password into formats, but this does not encrypt the data. It is usually used in conjunction with HTTPS (SSL/TLS) to ensure the security of data transmission.

questions.question_text: Which encoding is used to protect a username and login with RESTful API basic authentication?

SIMULATION
-


Guidelines
-

This is a lab item in which tasks will be performed on virtual devices.

• Refer to the Tasks tab to view the tasks for this lab item.
• Refer to the Topology tab to access the device console(s) and perform the tasks.
• Console access is available for all required devices by clicking the device icon or using the tab(s) above the console window.
• All necessary preconfigurations have been applied.
• Do not change the enable password or hostname for any device.
• Save your configurations to NVRAM before moving to the next item.
• Click Next at the bottom of the screen to submit this lab and move to the next question.
• When Next is clicked, the lab closes and cannot be reopened.


Topology
-

//IMG//



Tasks
-

OSPF is preconfigured on all devices except R20. Configure R20 to complete these tasks.

Task 1:

Configure OSPF according to the topology using these requirements:

• Use Process ID 20.
• Use Loopback0 for the Router ID.
• Advertise all networks into OSPF.

o Do not use network statements under the OSPF process to accomplish this task.

Task 2:

Configure a /18 summary route for Area 40.

• Advertise only Type 3 LSAs into Area 0.


R20
-

//IMG//

comments.content: Don't use stub, unless area 40 on R40 is also configured as a stub!! It will destory the neighborship, if only one of the routers is stub in the area. The "area 40 range..." command will summarize the route. If there are redistributed routes on R40, use a distribute-list on R20 to suppress them, this will stop the type 5 LSAs coming from area 40.

in task 2
R20(config-router)# area 40 stub no summay

Stub: flood default route + flood Type3LSA ( filter only type5 lsa)
Totally Stubby= as Stub but also filter Type3 LSA

Task 1:
you must add loopback advertisement on R20
R20(config)#interface loopback0
R20(config-if)#ip ospf 20 area 0

discussion.content:
Task 1:
R20# configure terminal
R20(config)# interface ethernet 0/0
R20(config-if)# ip ospf 20 area 0
R20(config)# interface ethernet 0/1
R20(config-if)# ip ospf 20 area 0
R20(config)# interface ethernet 0/2
R20(config-if)# ip ospf 20 area 40

Task 2:
R20# configure terminal
R20(config)# router ospf 20
R20(config-router)# area 40 range 10.40.0.0 255.255.192.0
R20(config-router)# area 40 stub

add command 'area 40 stub', for 'TYPE 3 LSAs only' of task 2.
the answer is correct. but look at then questing "Advertise all networks into OSPF." so on your exam, check if you see the loopback adress from the Rxx router. if so then advertise your loopback also

choices.C: R1 (config)# aaa authorization exec default group tacacs+
choices.A: R1(config)# aaa accounting commands 15 default start-stop group tacacs+
choices.D: R1 (config)# aaa authorization exec default local if-authenticated

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C answers the question:

#aaa new model
! Configure TACACS+ server(s):
tacacs-server host <tacacs-server-ip>
tacacs-server key <shared-secret>
! Set up AAA authentication for login:
#aaa authentication login default group tacacs+ local <--------
! This authorizes privilege level 15 commands using TACACS+, with local as fallback.

Selected Answer: C
grant access-level rights -> authorization

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which configuration must be applied for the TACACS+ server to grant access-level rights to remote users?
What is a characteristic of VXLAN?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. VTEP（VXLAN Tunnel Endpoints) -> encapsulate and de-encapsulate frames
B. 24-bit VNI
C. UDP
D. extends the Layer 2 network to the Layer 3 network .

choices.A: It uses VTEPs to encapsulate and de-encapsulate frames.
choices.D: It extends Layer 2 and Layer 3 overlay networks over a Layer 2 underlay.
